intro: Didymoplexiella ornata, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, yellow to orange composite flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a velvety texture. Didymoplexiella ornata thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
